trans-unit.source: Configure Azure Backup Services to prepare for back up of Windows Server | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure Azure Backup Services to prepare for back up of Windows Server | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use this tutorial to learn how to use the Backup service in Microsoft's Azure cloud offering to back up Windows Server to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Use this tutorial to learn how to use the Backup service in Microsoft's Azure cloud offering to back up Windows Server to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Configure Azure Backup to prepare for back up of Windows Server
trans-unit.target: Configure Azure Backup to prepare for back up of Windows Server

trans-unit.source: This article will lead you through enabling the Azure Backup feature.
trans-unit.target: This article will lead you through enabling the Azure Backup feature.

trans-unit.source: To back up Windows Server or Windows Client to Azure, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To back up Windows Server or Windows Client to Azure, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Previously you needed to create or acquire a X.509 v3 certificate in order to register your backup server.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Previously you needed to create or acquire a X.509 v3 certificate in order to register your backup server.

trans-unit.source: Certificates are still supported, but now to make Azure vault registration with a server easier, you can generate a vault credential right from the Quick Start page.
trans-unit.target: Certificates are still supported, but now to make Azure vault registration with a server easier, you can generate a vault credential right from the Quick Start page.

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: To back up files and data from your Windows Server to Azure, you must first:
trans-unit.target: To back up files and data from your Windows Server to Azure, you must first:

trans-unit.source: **Create a Backup vault** — Create a vault in the Azure Backup console.
trans-unit.target: **Create a Backup vault** — Create a vault in the Azure Backup console.

trans-unit.source: **Download vault credentials** — In Azure Backup, upload the management certificate you created to the vault.
trans-unit.target: **Download vault credentials** — In Azure Backup, upload the management certificate you created to the vault.

trans-unit.source: **Install the Azure Backup Agent and register the server** — From Azure Backup, install the agent and register the server in the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: **Install the Azure Backup Agent and register the server** — From Azure Backup, install the agent and register the server in the backup vault.
